item.title: Counseling Center New Location
item.description: The Counseling Center has moved to a new location within Academy Hall. You can now find us in Suite 4200 (next door) the space formerly occupied by ALAC.

item.title: Graduate Certificate Review | Aug. 5
item.description: Date: Tuesday, August 5, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., in a 30-minute information session highlighting the whole range of Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs. These certificates are three courses in length, developing targeted ability groups, and can be completed in as little as seven months. Please register if you plan to attend.

item.title: Campus Cleanout Days Scheduled this Summer
item.description: Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) and Environmental & Site Services (E&SS) are partnering with the campus community to encourage cleanouts of cluttered storage areas, offices, shops, and labs. Take advantage of these free events to prepare your spaces for the upcoming fall semester!

item.title: Campus Paving Updates
item.description: Please be advised that HMA will be paving on Tuesday, August 5th, and Wednesday, August 6th. During this time, Cook Drive will be closed to all traffic, with the exception of emergency vehicles, from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM each day. Additionally, the West Lot will close on Tuesday at 6:00 AM and is scheduled to reopen Wednesday at 6:00 PM, weather permitting. For any questions or concerns, please contact Matt Robinson: robinm10@rpi.ed

item.title: Workshop Series: Building Your Toolkit to Support Graduate Students | Aug. 6
item.description: Date: Wednesday, August 6, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM - Join Student Experience staff for two interactive workshops to enhance your toolkit for supporting graduate students at RPI. Learn tips and tricks to help you as a professional and life-long learner. Workshop Two: Teaching and Mentoring with Neurodivergence in Mind This session provides a foundational understanding of neurodivergence and how it shapes student behavior, communication, and learning.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: “Leading from Anywhere” | Aug. 5
item.description: Date: Tuesday, August 5, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:30 AM - At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. Whether it be leading a particular project or initiative, assisting others in overcoming obstacles and capitalizing on opportunities, or catalyzing co-creation with colleagues. In this workshop, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as…

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Supervisory Essentials”
item.description: In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience a “day in the life” of a Supervisor. In addition, the importance of managing employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.

item.title: Information Session for 2026 Project RFP: IBM-RPI Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC)
item.description:
Please join us on Thursday, August 7, 11am – 12pm for an Information Session regarding the Request for Joint Rensselaer/IBM Research Proposals. This RFP is part of the Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC), a collaborative research initiative between RPI and IBM to drive world class innovation and fundamental advances in artificial intelligence algorithm, AI hardware software co-design and Semiconductor Technology for the benefit of society. Please register at https://fcrc.rpi.edu/
